#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Find an Illustrator
#Text=Buying custom made artwork requires some degree of understanding of what the artist needs to know in order to fulfill your vision .
#Text=This is a guide to help you sound like a professional custom art buyer with ease .
#Text=A list of your requirements describing the art you envision .
#Text=For instance : a color drawing of a dog running up a hill , past a tall tree .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Know what you 're asking for .
#Text=Once your quest for the right illustrator has ended the next step is knowing how to instruct the artist to draw what you have in mind .
#Text=The best way to be satisfied with the art you order is to be extremely clear in your instructions .
#Text=The artist will appreciate a concise , to the point order .
#Text=Below is a list of questions designed to help organize your requests .
#Text=Know how many illustrations you want .
#Text=Be prepared for providing needed info .
#Text=For each illustration provide the following list of the elements to be included in the composition .
#Text=For example : A drawing of a collie dog , walking down a lane , in profile , past a line of trees with a clear , blue , cloudless sky in background .
#Text=The dog should be wearing a collar and have a pleasant expression .
#Text=Decide if the art will the art be in color or black and white .
#Text=Decide whether you want one or more prints , a digital image , or both .
#Text=If you are ordering prints , decide how many and what size you want .
#Text=Decide what purpose you 'll use the art for .
#Text=Know ahead of time , what the eye , hair and skin color of the subjects are .
#Text=Decide if you will be providing reference material or if you expect the artist to procure it .
#Text=Some artists will charge for finding reference material as it can be very time consuming .
#Text=You might consider finding the reference to save fees .
#Text=Decide if there will be any text on the page .
#Text=Do you want the artist to provide the text or leave room for your printer to place the text on the finished art .
#Text=If you want the artist to do it what font should be used .
#Text=If you are having your printing company place the text they can superimpose it on the digital art .
#Text=Do you need the artist to design a logo and if so what are your ideas for it ?
#Text=What is the message you want to convey ?
#Text=Do you want a logo you already have placed on the art ?
#Text=Can you supply a digital image of the logo .

#Text=You can ask the illustrator to show you samples of art they have which conveys the type and quality of the illustrations they create , however , do not expect them to have the exact thing you have in mind .
#Text=For instance if you want a picture of a bride on a skateboard and they have drawn skateboards and brides separately you can be confident they draw them together .
#Text=If the artist can draw an airplane but has not drawn a skateboard
#Text=be confident they can draw the skateboard .
#Text=Ask the artist if you will be supplied with a sketch before they go to the final finish .
#Text=Do not expect the artist to redraw the picture if you change your mind for the original layout without incurring more fees .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Be as specific in your instructions as possible to avoid disappointment and frustration .
#Text=The artist cannot read your mind so it is vital to provide good , solid instructions .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Expect to pay for time consuming changes .
